choices.D: Convert the date to Exact Date
choices.A: Select Show Missing Values for the date

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Both views demonstrate that use a continuous value of month and year but with different axis formatting. If we look closely to the first view we see that there are many months missing or skipped, so what's happening on the second view is that if you click show missing values, the axis automatically change its format to show the ticks in years.

Selected Answer: A
It will show missing values, no need to change the date to discrete or continuous.

C. Convert the date to Continuous
Why is it exact Date? If it is exact date and discrete each bin in the bar chart shows exact date if you change it to continuous bar chart converts to area chart. The given answer might be correct

questions.question_text: In which three formats can you export a worksheet from the Worksheet menu? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: A,B,C is correct

Selected Answer: ABC
The solution is wrong. It is not ABD. It is ABC

Selected Answer: ABC
A. .csv
B. .xlsx
C. .png
We can Export Work Sheet to Image (.png), Data (.csv), Excel Format (.xlsx)

choices.C: Bring in the secondary data source by using relationships. From the Data pane, right-click Dorm_Name. select Replace References and then select Dorm_Name_New.
choices.B: Bring in the secondary table as a left join to the primary data source. From the Data Source page select Create Calculated Field in the Dorm_Name field and enter [Dorm_Name_New] in the calculation window.
choices.A: Bring in the secondary data source as a union.
choices.D: Create a data blend and select Edit Primary Aliases to replace the primary data source alias values with values from the secondary data source.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Data blending alows make a left join with a common field like Dorm Name. This will allow to bring the Dorm_code_new field. On the primary data source we could correct the value "Mazy" on Alias feature to make it equal to the "Mazie" value so that we bring the "A5" value.
None of the answers are correcrt.C will use the new name.

Reasons on Why Option C is not correct
1.We need to replace the Dorm Code and not the Dorm Name. So, If we use Option C, then Replace reference on Dorm_code will replace the values with Dorm_code_new. But the column name also will be changed as Dorm _code_new. Expectation is Column name should be same.
 We should not replace reference the Dorm_name field.

Option D Would solve this use case.

Selected Answer: C
Replace reference
C is not correct as relationship is for multiple connections instead of datasources.

discussion.content: C should be the answer, as replace references is easier. It is possible to do with B, but you'd be creating an extra dimension for no reason.

Selected Answer: C
Replace reference is the easiest way to replace/update the dimension. Answer should be C
Replace reference is the easiest way to replace/update the dimension. Answer should be C
